definition[0]: to move, or to make someone or something move
example[0]: She leaned on the door, but it wouldn’t budge.
example[1]: The horse refused to budge an inch.
example[2]: Will hasn’t budged from his room all day.
definition[1]: to change your opinion, or to make someone change their opinion
example[3]: The government has refused to budge.
example[4]: He won’t budge on the issue.
example[5]: Treacy refuses to budge from his principles.
